John,
As others have said, today it would probably be attributed to Katchus=
hi.  When I first glanced at the shumei I picked up on the second character=
 as the "a" =E9=98=BF in Shoami and then on the next character as the middl=
e kanji =E4=B9=99 from Saotome.  Of course the rest does not fit either cas=
e, although Saotome and Ko-Shoami would be somewhat defensible attributions=
.  The first kanji looks like ichi/kazu =E4=B8=80 and the last ko =E5=B0=8F=
.  I can't make sense of it, but feel like I must be missing something obvi=
ous.  The other character at the left appears to be a kao, although I do no=
t know who it belongs to.

 I also spent time on your gold seal when you po=
sted it, but struck out on that one too.  I don't have a tensho dictionary =
so I asked my shodo teacher to look it up, but couldn't conclude on any kno=
wn tsubako.

They're both bugging me, so if I turn anything up I will post =
it.  Meanwhile, hopefully someone else will take a look and settle it.

Sor=
ry,
Jim




  A colleage, and collector, has recently purchased the sukashi=
 tsuba 
  illustrated in my Photo Album JPL and has asked for my advice 
  =
regarding its possible attribution and for a translation of the red 
  lacq=
uer inscription  The figure on the bottom left appears to be a 
  kao, but =
I am otherwise at a complete loss.  Any help/suggestions re 
  either of th=
ese requests would be much appreciated.

  While you are in my Photo Album,=
 I am still seeking some information 
  on the gold, hira-zogan seal.  Ther=
e has been a complete absence of 
  replies to my earlier request regarding=
 this.

  Grateful thanks and regards, JPL.
